page.title: 13THE POPLARS.
page.content: The Poplars School is in Stoke Park hospital grounds.It is a school for severely educationally subnormal children from 3-18 years.Children's handicaps range from severe mental handicap to physical disabilities such as epilepsy,blindness and deafness. Most of the children have no language. There are 34 children in the school at present.There are 5 teachers,a headteacher,7 nursery nurses and a secretary.There are 5 classes,with between 5 and 7 children in each;2 children are taught on the ward in which they live.31 children are resident ,3 come daily,2 by taxi and 1 brought by the parents.The school has many special facilities including the use of a hydropool,horse riding,a specially adapted mini bus and daily visits from physio and speech therapists.
